title: How to write 250 character essay - Quora

response.answer_text: It's impossible for me to believe that anything less than two tweets long could be called an “essay.” Of course a 17-syllable haiku is a poem, but poetry isn't prose (how’s that for belaboring the obvious?) Please tell us that the assignment was 250 words, which is still shorter than Abraham Lincoln’s 272-word Gettysburg Address. I doubt seriously that any of the guides offer much help with something this short, but here’s a thought or two if this was a genuine assignment: Don't utilize polysyllabic words, use short words. Don't waste space on quotations from others unless it would take more words to,say the same thing yourself. Get rid of everything similar to “I think” and “In my opinion.” Consider an “essay” based on a list, but a list that tells a story (250 characters, including spaces): My 9 favorite words: Mary. My wife’s name. Yes! When I proposed. Bobby. My son. Mama. His first word. Sara, Bob’s wife. Pops. What Sara calls me. Jacko. Our grandchild. Grandy. What Jacko calls me. Memaw is Mary. My 2 least favorite: Cancer. Incurable.

That’s not an essay, it’s a tweet. Which can actually make it harder to make a point, because you’re so limited on how much space you have to work with. Start by planning your main point and supporting logic, and write it in as few words as possible, then iterate through as many drafts as needed to get it below the the 140 character limit.
